curam.util.cache
Interface Cache<K,V>

Type Parameters:
K - the cache key
V - the cache value
public interface Cache<K,V>

A cache.

Method Detail

addListener

void addListener(CacheListener<K> listener)
Adds a cache listener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add

removeListener

void removeListener(CacheListener<K> listener)
Removes a cache listener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

clear

void clear()
Clears all objects from this cache.

containsKey

boolean containsKey(K key)
Checks if this cache contains a mapping for key key.

Parameters:
key - the key
Returns:
true if the cache contains the specified key

containsValue

boolean containsValue(V value)
Checks if object value exists in the cache.

Parameters:
value - the value
Returns:
true if this cache maps one or more keys to the specified value

put

void put(K key,
         V value)
Adds object value to the cached keyed by key.

Parameters:
key - the object's key
value - the object to add to the cache

remove

V remove(K key)
Removes the object mapped to key from the cache.

Parameters:
key - the oobject's key
Returns:
the object removed from the cache or null if no object with key key was found in the cache.

getAll

java.util.Map<K,V> getAll(java.util.Set<K> keys)
This method returns all the objects mapped to any of the keys in keys. If an object is not found in the cache, a call to the registered cache loaders will be made if such loaders exists.

Parameters:
keys - the set of keys
Returns:
all the objects mapped to keys

get

V get(K key)
This method returns the object mapped to key key. If an object is not found in the cache, calls to the registered cache loaders will be made if such loaders exists.

Parameters:
key - the object's key
Returns:
the object mapped to key

getEntry

CacheEntry<V> getEntry(K key)
This method returns the cache entry for the object mapped to key key. This method behaves similar to Cache.get(Object), the only difference being that the cache entry is returned rather than just the cached object.

Parameters:
key - the object's key
Returns:
the cache entry mapped to key

load

void load(K key)
Uses the associated cache loader to load an object for key key . The loading could be done asynchronously.

Parameters:
key - the object's key

loadAll

void loadAll(java.util.Set<K> keys)
Uses the associated cache loader to load all objects with keys in keys. The loading could be done asynchronously.

Parameters:
keys - the key set; This value can be null meaning that the registered loaders should load all available objects into the cache.

peek

V peek(K key)
Returns the object mapped to key key if it exists and is valid. If the object doesn't exist it returns null.

Parameters:
key - the object's key
Returns:
the object mapped to key if it exists and is valid. If the object doesn't exists it returns null.

registerCacheLoader

void registerCacheLoader(CacheLoader<K,V> loader)
Registers a cache loader. More than one cache loader can be registered and during calls to Cache.get(Object) or Cache.getAll(Set), the cache loader calls will be chained until the requested object is loaded.

Parameters:
loader - the loader to register

unregisterCacheLoader

void unregisterCacheLoader(CacheLoader<K,V> loader)
Unregisters a cache loader.

Parameters:
loader - the loader to unregister

getStatistics

CacheStatistics getStatistics(CacheStatistics.Accuracy accuracy)
Retrieves cache statistics with the accuracy described in accuracy.

Parameters:
accuracy - the statistics accuracy
Returns:
cache statistics

resetStatistics

void resetStatistics()
Resets the statistics.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this cache.

Returns:
the name of the cache

getKeyIterator

java.util.Iterator<K> getKeyIterator()
Returns an iterator over the keys in the cache. Some caches support only a read only iterator that throws UnsupportedOperationException if Iterator.remove() is invoked.

Returns:
an iterator over the keys in the cache

registerEvictionApprover

void registerEvictionApprover(CacheEvictionApprover<K,V> cea)
Registers an eviction approver to be able to veto the eviction of items from the cache. More than one eviction approver can be registered. An item is evicted only if none of the registered approvers vetoed the eviction.

Parameters:
cea - the eviction approver to register

unregisterEvictionApprover

void unregisterEvictionApprover(CacheEvictionApprover<K,V> cea)
Unregisters an eviction approver.

Parameters:
cea - the eviction approver to unregister
